Repo! The Genetic Opera is my new obsession, best new cult film ever! 

Ok so you hear a cast list of Alexa Vega, Paris Hilton and Sarah Brightman and you cringe, right? But for some reason, they are all really great in this film! That music is addictive as hell and I can't stop listening to it. It's a rock opera, and all the songs, well most are shot in music video style, jumping from place to place and scene to scene. I'm thinking I'll order it online soon because I haven't loved a movie like this in a long time. And just by chance, everyone in the theater department is discovering it about the same time. I saw it for the first time the second week of class, and my friend Kerry saw it with all his GSSU friends a week later just because someone they knew had it. I was talking about it at an APO (Co-ed Theater Frat) rush event and people kept interjecting their thoughts on it and none of these people had seen it with us. The movie is a year old, but it's starting to experience super popularity right now among CNU theater students if no one else.

There's this character in it, Graverobber (yup), who you would never in a million years think of me being attracted to. He has long hair, wears gothic make-up, the character is a sort of medical drug dealer, and some reason I'm hot for the Graverobber. He doesn't have the best voice, and he's pretty good looking, but usually long hair cancels that out for me. But he just sort of exudes hot sexual bad boy and it's hot. Only bad bit is his character basically has sex with Paris Hilton on screen a few times since he's her dealer. But he also rescues Shilo a lot, although there's one part in the deleted scenes where it seems like he's trying to seduce her, though it's a bit difficult since he's trapped, hung up-side down in a tomb where Shilo finds him to ask for some Zydrate. I love the song Zydrate Anatomy, it just goes through my head on repeat. 

Anyway, you can watch it on SurftheChannel, or you can buy or rent it, it's kind of amazing! So I suggest it. Though is gets really gory at bits, it's called Repo because the repo man comes to repossess organs that people don't pay for. 

Interesting thing about the Graverobber though- the actor who plays him wrote Repo, and did all the illustrations for the comic book storytelling where all the backstory gets filled in. 

SO good.

I really do, I specifically listen to indie music as I walk around campus, because I feel like that's just quintessential college student. I wear lipstick EVERY DAY, and straighten my hair every day, and I wear heels almost every day. The only shoes I brought were heels and sneakers for those days that require more movement. I still read the Belle De Jour novels, imported the third one and it arrived the other day. I even have a Jane Austen plushy sitting on my desk. I have an Audrey Hepburn poster and a David Tennant Poster I picked up in Edinburgh that are on my walls. 

But in other news, my room got detripled, so I'm in a different bed now, and the room seems massive, we have like 10 square feet of empty space in the middle. It's kinda lonely, though I don't mind my new bed. though it doesn't give me a creepily great view of the entire room. Creepy because I can see my roommate very well from my bed and I feel like a creeper if I look down now. But I have a lot more space, although my mug-bowl from Paris got smashed in the process :C it's glued back together except for about 10 percent that got hurt the worst and that 10% just happens to be a hole at the bottom :(. Very Sad. But I talked to my parents and they said they may be going back to Paris next October with my sister so they would buy me another. That made me happier by far. 

I spend every night lately talking to Jeremy for at least an hour. IMing people from fairfax and I've connected again to Jacob, we IM about his ever changing love life, since he and Piper broke up he's tried to get back on the dating scene, and it seems Piper might be happier with out him (but I've known that for awhile). I totally creeped on robinsondrama and found the cast list for Rumors. I started IMing and congratulating people AND I found out that Rachel (my fave and my 'daughter' in Fiddler) got an amazing part AND Madison is her understudy! That made me so happy. All summer I was telling Rachel she was better than Madison and deserved to get better roles because Madison's head has become the size of Saturn since she kept getting leads and Replogle made it clear she was his favorite. And then THIS happened. I sent Rachel a text saying 'I told you you were better than Madison' Evil, maybe, but it felt like justice. Julieanna also got a good role, and so did Alex (who I'm starting to love just a bit since he's started changing for the better). I'm so proud of all my Robinson friends, I'm excited to see the show. 

College seems very chill compared to Robinson, my courses aren't more difficult, they're a faster pace but I got AMAZING teachers (except my history teacher, I think I know more than him about half of what he's teaching). I LOVE Frau Carter and all the other teachers. Her especially, she makes our german class all about hitting on someone in a bar in Germany and how you start the conversation. College german is all conversational, less learning to say things like cat and tree. 

I've really started to listen to listen to Lilly Allen non-stop, she's fabulous. I love love love her music. It's clever, cute and sometimes just awesome girl bitchyness at exboyfriends. I <3 her big time. And she's gorgeous. J-Bethea would like her I think, simply because she looks like Katy Perry/Zoey Deschennel- his two loves. 

Anyway... one more hour til German...what to do what to do...

Except it's gonna be a really low budget Sarah Palin, it's super hot out so I'm not gonna do the full suit, just a high wasted pencil skirt with a white shirt. My audition outfit :/ oh well. 
My CA is driving, CA stands for 'collaborative artist' and it's upper classmen who take little freshman under their wing and teach us all about the theatre dept at CNU, she's giving me a ride, kind of. Her room mate's boyfriend is giving me a ride and she's in the car. Apparently he's buying a keg, so I'm just gonna have to watch out. I don't think I'll drink, I don't want to do anything I might regret. I'm really glad that I got invited to a legit party in the drama dept, they're all really nice and want to get all the freshman involved.

It's bugging the hell out of me. I miss Jeremy like crazy, and I hope he can get down here soon. 

one of my goals worked! kind of. I had a goal for people to only see me with lipstick on, and today I was too lazy to put it on before heading to breakfast with the 3rd floor, and one of the guys came into Regattas and when I said hi he said 'Woah, I almost didn't recognize you without your make-up and lipstick on. I hope guy from my german class, Dan, didn't recognize me, he was outside Regattas when I went in.

I kinda hate being so busy-not a lot of time for fun reading. My sister got so much reading done in college- I must be too social.

I'm have a great time, I love the people, the food, the campus. I'm just always busy.
Last night I got invited to go to a movie night at Santoro- the party dorm, and everyone was telling me not to go because if a guy invited you to Santoro it means he wants to fuck you. He seemed really nice so I went anyway, and nothing at all happened, partially because I'm good at keeping a foot away from guys.
Now you're wondering- why would that be a problem? He should know you have a boyfriend.
Well the guy sits next to me in German, we've only gone so far as 'what's you name, what's your phone number, where are you from' in my German class, and those topics are all we had talked about. I personally, feel kind weird saying 'oh my boyfriend' all the time, I feel like thats a bit weird, so I only talk about Jeremy if it comes up in conversation- I don't like to make a big deal over the fact that I'm in a relationship, everyone in my hall knows because I have picture of him all over my desk and dresser, but if it doesn't come up, I don't mention it. So since Santoro guy never asked, I never said anything, but after the movie, the way he talked to me, he was so sweet and nice and the way he said things- I'm pretty sure he likes me, so now I've got to find some way of slipping Jeremy into conversation so I don't lead him on. I even insulted things I liked that he liked because those things could have led the conversation in a romantic direction and I couldn't have that. I just wanted to get to my dorm as quickly as possible so I could say good night and go. 
I told Jeremy about it and he said he wanted to visit, meet any guy who's ever expressed any interest in me and make out in front of them. I told him that was stupid and mean. He agreed. 

I didn't get called back or cast in the fall shows- not surprising- I'm a freshman girl, and only 2 got called back out of 20, so if only 10% got called back, I don't feel bad at all. 
ANYWAY, there's an Alpha Psi Omega picnic this afternoon/night so I'm gonna go to that- it's a co-ed theater fraternity that I hope to be a big part of, it's just like ITS point system, so I'm gonna do EVERYTHING I can for them and hopefully pledge next year. 

Classes are not too tough, but I was talked to a sophmore yesterday who said you think you're doing well- and then your grade is a C. So I'm gonna try and be the Hermione of CNU, and work super over hard. Suck up and write way above and beyond what my theatre teachers ask of me, except the voice teacher, she's super chill so I'm not gonna worry about that one.

I got into an accident on the way home from Jeremy's house. No one got hurt, his car doesn't look like anything happened at all, my car on the other hand... wheels are out of alignment, light is smashed in. He said I was at fault, but I'm not exactly sure, he was stopped in the middle of the road right after a traffic light, it was a really bad place to be stopped, and he was talking to someone through his window, I call that slightly irresponsible. It's not horrible, it's just really super inconvenient, insurance is taking care of it, and even though it makes my rates go up, I'll be able to drive for another two weeks after Europe anyhow. So it's not a huge loss, because I'll be off the plan soon anyway (I'm not allowed to drive in college, my parents don't think college kids should have cars- dangerous). It's super inconvenient though, because I have so many places to go this week! So much to do.
My parents and I called insurance and it's all covered, but I still feel crappy, and I keep randomly crying- but that's to be expected after this sort of thing. My parents are basically taking the 'life moves on' frame of mind to this, but I wish it were winter so I curl up in a blanket with some hot coffee- coffee makes everything better. 
This could work to my advantage, in the book I wrote, I took an unexpected turn which took away some of the climax, but I could put the character in a mini car wreck... hrm, I'll have to contemplated this one. 

You know, today I thought I was just gonna put up a mini entry saying 'yay, I got a new phone, it's pretty and maroon and I have unlimited txting now... alas. 

I hate life sometimes.... I was so happy. It was bound to happen I suppose. God does this to us when everything is going about 95% right. He just throws us a curve ball to keep us in check and on our guard and remind us that life is fleeting. Huh, now I'm thinking some moderately deep and questioning thoughts. Slightly unsettling

I love my boyfriend, Legit love him. Like I've fallen in love with and love him, and YES it seems sudden, considering we've only been dating a month, BUT I think I've been in enough relationship to know that I really do love him, if I don't see him for a day, that days sucks, not one day goes by where we don't talk. My feelings for him are so different from every other boy I've been with, I never want our relationship to end, with a lot of boys I put a ticking clock on it, when I think it'll probably end, I haven't with him. 
And I've kind of been absorbed into his family, he and his sister are going to church and youth group with me tomorrow and his sister is going to see my prom dress so she'll can help him find a tux to go with it. Caitlin (his little sister) is becoming like my little sister, I give her boy advice and teach her simple life lessons that only girls know. She has two older brothers so there are a few things she's never learned. It's kinda funny, but I go to Jeremy's house to hang out with him, and what ends up happening is I'll go over, sit on Jeremy's lap or have Jeremy's arms around me and just talk to Caitlin while he and his brother argue. Apparently Brandon's really upset because I've stolen his brother from him. Yet he continues to take pictures of us together, he apparently wants Jeremy to turn me into a gamer, but we all know it's not going to happen. 
His parents also love me, at least they pretend to, and they dont mind that Jeremy and I spend a lot of time in his room with the door closed... But Jeremy has to keep his door closed or his cats will get in and destroy things, and we go into his room because it's convenient and comfortable... 
I love him, it's weird, but we remind me of my parents. How we're so young, but yet I don't feel young with him, I feel right. like it's right. and we're right together. 

I know. Mushy. Yup. 
but hey, first time I've ever been in love. so I think I'm allowed

For probably two years now, I've been under the impression that I am probably a shallow person. I would tell myself that I would only date attractive guys and guys that would pay and be able to drive. And I think I mostly continued to think this because people kept saying that I was shallow and telling me how shallow. Not like it was bad, just like stating a fact. 
But I DON'T generally date attractive guys, I've noticed. Brantley- eh, he was OK but weighed less than me. And my current boyfriend is adorable, but he's not really attractive. But something about him being himself makes me so happy and so happy to be with him. 
By the way, if you've EVER seen a show at fairfax high school, chances are, he was in it! He was Lumier in last year's Beauty and the Beast- Craig should know who this is! Jeremy Tuohy, possibly the funniest, sweetest boy I have ever met.
So I was like his second kiss ever apparently, and first girl he has ever made out with. It's super adorable and I totally don't mind how innocent he is, it's only frustrating when I'm in a super flirty mood and he gets freaked out and confuse. But he and his family are the most adorable thing in the world. His sister and I want to have a Gilmore Girl's marathon, and I believe Jeremy and I need to have a Simon Pegg marathon. I love that man. 

It's a bit freaky, but I think I may be falling in love with Jeremy. We went to a Ceili which is an Irish social dance thing tonight. And he danced with me, like the waltzes and reels... I suddenly understand romance novels so much more, dancing with a guy like that really is an experience. Jeremy leads REALLY well, somehow we just after awhile *CORNY ALERT* seemed to almost float together on the floor. IT WAS GREAT! 

I wonder if a first week of a relationship can be telling. Because after a week or two with Brantley, I felt like it wasn't gonna work and needed to end sometime soon, I found myself wanting friend time more than Brantley time. and Here I find myself wanting to be with Jeremy. Jeremy and his family and his friends and Jeremy and my friends and family... 
He makes me so happy, just our conversations, he is the nerdiest, most fun guy I think I've ever been with. 
He's a super nerd (loves D&D and WoW), not amazingly attractive, and super innocent. He's the opposite of what I thought I wanted. Yet I want to be with him more than I can even say. Life is funny, ain't it?

First day of school we said hi, and then he drove me home on wednesday and thursday. And quite a few other times... And we met up every football game and hung out...Talked at homecoming.

And after the football game yesterday we uh...hung out... but funny thing
When he kissed me (I never thought this happened, it was scary almost) I could barely walk, my knees were shaking and I could barely stand. Apparently weak knees does actually occur... it was...scarily surprising...
Just thought that was a fun little story over the course of 5 years...

I just finished an AMAZINGLY good book, the second book in the AMAZINGLY AMAZING series Outlander, by Diana Gabaldon. And I'm currently experiencing what I like to call a surge of Scottish obsession. Last summer when I came back from Scotland, my dad told me  I should have looked for the plaid of Bean, cuz apparently my great-grandmother was also scottish, not just my great-grandfather. So I looked up Bean for the first time today and it turns out that the Bean 'lands' are actually where this story starts. Inverness- where the lochness also is. 
And now I want to learn Gaelic so badly! Like you don't even know! Next summer, my parents said they would take me to London, Wales and Edinburgh. I just have to tell them where I want to go and find out some of the information for them. So now I need to go to Inverness no doubt! And Edinburgh, and talk to people about Gaelic... 

oh and I might as well give a pitch for Outlander as well. I've been telling a lot of people about it, and all those who know it or have read it know how amazing it is. 

ok so, WWII just ended, a woman and her husband are on their second honeymoon after being separated for 6 years by the war. The woman (claire) goes out to this stone circle one day and suddenly, when walking through and around the stones, is pulled through to somewhere entirely the same but completely different. She sees her self in the middle of some sort of battle, very confused she runs into the woods. She thinks she's just interrupted a  filming of some sort, but where are the camera crews...? Suddenly a man dressed as a Dragoon appears... and he looks just like her husband....

IT"S SOOOOOOO GOOD! She later meets a man named Jamie, and Jamie is just the most adorable, amazing man ever! 

The book's got a lot of graphic sex and violence, btw. But it's amazing! And the second book is JUST as amazing! The second book doesn't have the same romance element, but it's a continuation of an amazing story and it's unbelievably amazing. A lot of reviews of the book that I read out of curiosity said things like, 'I didn't expect to like it, but I LOVED it.' and something actually really caught my attention, one person said that it helped her to understand love better. What love is and what it means. These really are beautiful, amazing books- and I HIGHLY recommend them to anyone. 

I'm so glad the third book is sitting here in front of me! Now I just need to buy the fourth, trade my sister for the fifth, and buy the sixth....

CAI:
It's been a great first week, although our choreographer annoys the hell out of me most the time. That's how things usually are for me. But I'm realizing how insanely weak I am compared to professionals. The three broadway actors that came to us (well, dancer/actors) all had great stamina and were strong and confidents and basically amazing. I'm starting to TRULY realize how much work goes into this profession. And I'm not sure I could actually afford to live and work in New York ever, even though it's my dream. Starting in DC is definently an option, but how am I going to survive out of college? I wont be able to afford an apartment... EEK! So many worries are popping up before they need to. All I can think is how I need to work while I'm in college and save up so that I can eventually afford a place to live and afford to be out of work for a few months at a time. Even the most successful broadway actors can be out of work for months on end. The girl we met from Cry Baby, Cameron Adams, she found out five days prior that her show was closing and she didn't have a job set up until 2 months from now so she's out of work for two months... 
Ack, being an actor scares me so much. I love performing, and I LOVE portraying a character on stage and creating a character, but I am so scared that I wont make it. But I have to- I have to work and be 'successful' and by successful, I don't mean famous, I mean- able to make a living doing what I love. 
And like one of our teachers says- we don't work because we want to, we work because we have to. And that's the drive that keeps us trying our hardest at auditions and even doing shows we hate sometimes, because we HAVE to. 

Although you can't box yourself in with only theatre stuff- because if all you do is theatre how can you reflect life? So I've start to read magazine articles, and I don't mind informing myself on things in the world. It's good to stay up date on whats going on outside of theatre and to have other interests and passions. It also makes you a much more interesting person. I think...
